title: ADDIE Model-Based Blended Online Higher Mathematics Learning Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of undergraduate mathematics fundamentals (calculus, linear algebra)
context.additional_context: A blended classroom environment utilizing digital devices (tablets/laptops), operating a formative assessment-centered feedback system

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of multivariable calculus (chain rule, partial derivatives) with 80% accuracy through online modules and face-to-face instruction
Learners can demonstrate step-by-step optimization problem-solving processes using interactive simulation tools provided in the Learning Management System (LMS)
Learners can enhance mathematical modeling skills by over 70% through weekly quizzes and peer review assignments

resources: Digital Textbooks and Video Lecture Materials
Mathematical computation software such as Wolfram Alpha

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
